There are 157 J.Lindeberg stores in several of the major fashion capitals of the world, such as Copenhagen, New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Shanghai. The wholesale distribution features close to 2000 stores, including the leading high-end department and specialty stores around the world.

title: Key Account Executive
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Key Account Executive!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years, and together we are working to deliver a smoke-free Nordics by 2035.
   

  

 Our Nordic region employs 1,600 people in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, and Norway, including in production facilities, retail stores, and the Swedish Match innovation center and museum in Stockholm.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The Key Account Executive will support the commercial team of Swedish Match Nordics in building and maintaining strong cooperation with assigned major Swedish retail chains and wholesalers, to reach short- and long-term business objectives, and to deliver sustainable business growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Support and develop the investment strategy & contract negotiations, and ensure compliance of client agreements through regular monitoring
* Support and lead the development of competitive account strategies & activation plans, in line with the defined channel strategies, to deliver market share increase and profitability
* Coordinate the preparation and implementation of commercial programs & initiatives for these accounts, by ensuring proper communication of brand cycles, new brand launches and line extensions, to maintain superior brand support and flawless execution of designated activities
* Identify and capture business building opportunities, by regularly measuring and analyzing programs performance and effectiveness, benchmark against competitors’ activities in the channel to identify and address potential opportunities for upgrades and improvements
* Capitalize on professional expertise in channel trends to ensure sustainable competitive advantage of programs and channel management tools
* Support Key Account Managers and Head of Key Accounts in the definition of channel strategies, providing improvement suggestions to sustain current and ensure future growth.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor of Science in Business Administration or equivalent higher education
* Proficiency in Swedish and English
* Experience of Swedish trade environment and category management practices, with demonstrable experience in FMCG / Sales / Retail or a commercial role
* Agile learner with strong action orientation and drive for results
* Outstanding collaborative working (legal, compliance, marketing…)
* Mobile and willing to travel around Sweden (transport provided)
* Excel, Word, PowerPoint & strong ability to use advanced reporting tools
* Experience in NielsenIQ & Nielsen Spaceman
* Experience from corporate budget management
* High technical capabilities


 Do you not meet all our requirements 100%? The person we are looking for would not have let that stop them!
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**763**

title: Innovation & Process Analyst SM&P
description:
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. Within TUI Group, TUI Airline regroups all airline activities across UK, Nordics, Belgium, The Netherlands, Germany, Spain, Morocco, France, and the Dutch Antilles. The Supplier Management & Procurement (SM&P) team plays a key commercial role in TUI Airline, optimising value in all aviation contracts.
   

  

 As
 **Innovation & Process Analyst** 
 you will take a critical role in managing and developing all operational business and procurement data and activities within SM&P. You will develop reporting outputs that will allow for data-driven procurement and supplier management, and these reports will be used to influence the actions of senior managers.
   

  

 You will challenge suppliers, as well as the business with innovative improvements. You will identify and project manage new value adding procurement data processes. In this role you will develop and leverage an excellent network, cooperate with internal and external stakeholders. You will stay current and be the SM&P expert on business developments.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll report to the
 **Senior Manager of Business Performance & Development** 
 .
   

  

**About The Role**
* You will play a critical part in developing and managing a reliable, structured, effective and knowledgeable competence centre within SM&P for all related operational business and procurement data and activities/analysis. You will act as SM&P business partner and drive innovation towards SM&P colleagues and business functions by advising and recommending to ensure proper follow-up of long-term supplier performance.
+ By working with IT in a Business Intelligence (BI) environment, you will lead the automation and digitalization of data collection for the SM&P area.
+ You will project manage the setup of SM&P BI systems and define interfaces/visualisations and identify and describe SM&P data requirements and set targets for operational data to support procurement projects and strategy, supplier KPI’s and to monitor long-term supplier performance and the relevant KPI’s that are in line with SM&P’s and the company’s strategic vision.
+ You will evaluate data quality and test correctness of data, monitor results make recommendations to the team and perform pro-active and predictive analysis and forecasts as well as constantly consider any implications and further data and analysis that may be required.

* By working with SM&P colleagues, you will support procurement projects by providing requested data, or setup and manage a project to obtain requested data, if it is not yet centrally available. Joining procurement specialists or managers on selected visits/meetings with suppliers or stakeholders to discuss specific performance KPI’s and be the subject expert when providing guidance on definition; how KPI’s will/can be tracked, etc. Based on the KPI data collected you will provide insights to influence senior decision makers.
+ You will manage compliance and accuracy in terms of (supplier) operational business data input by confirming with business owners and stakeholders the definition and source of information; determine how KPI’s will be tracked and be familiar with the tools used. As part of the supplier management programme, you will also work closely with suppliers to obtain KPI data.
+ You will take ownership of supplier operational business data databases, reporting and presentations through the validation and coordination of supplier performance reports across the different categories. You will ensure consistency in reporting across different areas of responsibility and determine, together with business owners and SM&P colleagues, the root cause of potential performance issues and investigate an appropriate remedy.

* You will be required to develop advanced knowledge of the insurance claims process for which you will co-ordinate as subject matter expert on behalf of TUI Airlines. You will need to manage stakeholders (such as SM&P, the TUI Airlines, TUI Group Insurance team, Suppliers and TUI insurance broker, finance, legal, etc) as well as regularly review the claim process, provide training on this process, improve efficiency and make sure you maintain an overview of claims, status, etc. across all TUI Airlines.
* Through (self) auditing you will work with the SM&P team members to evaluate working in accordance with SM&P processes and procedures and TUI Group policies. You present your advice and recommendations regarding the outcome of the audit to senior managers.
* You take ownership of economic databases, reporting and presentations including validation, coordination and presentation of saving reports of all procurement activities/projects and ensure consistency in reporting across different areas of responsibility. You will collect, consolidate, interpret and communicate/present relevant economic parameters or data (market, countries, suppliers, geopolitics) that may impact department goals, decision making or contract projects/closures.
* You will support the Senior Manager of BPD as a business partner towards the finance team and will also contribute your expertise towards SM&P colleagues by providing ongoing review and support to SM&P team members during procurement projects, including financial analysis of proposals. You will support and review initial financial analysis for submission to relevant internal stakeholders and perform spend analysis, to continuously detect and materialize saving opportunities as part of a strategic approach and planning. This will include supporting the Business Case process. When required, you will join SM&P team members on selected visits/meetings with suppliers or stakeholders to safeguard the economic/financial aspects, of any projects.
* You will develop and leverage an excellent network and cooperation with internal (SM&P colleagues, operational functions, Aviation IT, etc.) and external (suppliers, etc.) stakeholders, so as to ensure the best input and output within your scope. Ensure that SM&P maintains industry best practice as well as knowledge of business/supplier developments through relevant reading, networking, meetings or attending conferences/workshops. Ensure you are acting according to TUI values and relevant finance/procurement policies and overlook the function/department for such overall compliance as well.


**About You**
* Have at least a bachelor degree, preferably master’s degree in business management, economics, accounting, statistics, aviation or computer and information science
* At least three years of relevant experience. Financial or accounting experience is desirable
* Highly proficient in English, knowledge of other languages desirable but not essential
* Be business/commercially oriented and have a business/IT hybrid profile
* Experience of managing projects, planning delivery and coordinating the inputs from different stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes
* Experience working with senior level stakeholders, external stakeholders; able to influence behavior and opinions based on knowledge and experience
* Have strong numeric, analytical and problem-solving skills with eye for detail
* Have good PC skills with an advanced knowledge of Excel, Access, knowledge of Oracle and SQL is desired but not essential
* Able to work, always innovating, in a rapidly change environment, prioritising accordingly
* Be self-motivated to get things done, take initiative
* Able to easily develop a strong network of contacts throughout the business and industry, gaining the support and commitment of key players to key projects
* Experience with at least one of the aviation operational categories (Engineering & Maintenance, Airline Operations, Customer Operations, etc.) is desired but not essential
* Experience as business intelligence analyst is desired but not essential
* Ability to identify and understand key drivers in any scenario
* Ability to challenge assumptions, to ask critical questions and to think out of the box
* Evidence of making decisions & influencing others to deliver to high standards in a fast-moving operational environment
* Effective communication and reporting skills, able to tailor messaging for different stakeholders
* Good sense of commercial acumen & financial awareness
* Able to travel regularly to meet with suppliers and internal stakeholders, for example
* Able to work according to TUI values and procurement policies


**About Our Offer**
* Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
* Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
* Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of (digital) training opportunities and international career opportunities.
* Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA
   

  

 If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk
   

  

 We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

title: International Business Developer - Sectra Communication
description:
**Do you like a challenge? Do you want to join a market leading company and help us secure countries "deepest" secrets?**
 At Sectra, we create technology that contribute to a healthier and safer society. You will be given the opportunity to put your skills to real use, challenge yourself, and make a difference within our society. As a Business Developer you will work in a sales team and be responsible for sales of cryptographic products and services to our customers internationally. Our solutions for critical IT and communication security play a key role in our mission to strengthen the stability and efficiency of society’s most important functions. Now we are looking for you who want to be a part of this great journey.
   

  

**Working as a Business developer**
 The role includes responsibilities such as:
   

  

* Identifying, developing and managing sales of Sectras secure communication products and services to new and/or existing customers, within a designated region or market segment
* Upholding the commercial relationship with the customer and drive business growth
* Delivery of committed results in time
* Acquiring and maintaining knowledge of applicable Sectra products


 "Our customers are passionate and take part in the development of our products. Every customer visit gives me new ideas and insights which can be taken back to my colleagues."
   

  

 ,
   

  

 At Sectra, we hire for attitude and ability – train for skill. This means who you are is more important than your previous experiences. There are a few core abilities that are central for any role. We always look for your willingness and ability to learn and take on new tasks fast, utilize previous experiences and quickly grasp new information. We also want you to have a strong analytical mindset in which we consider it to be important that you can understand and break down and solve problems. We also look for good communicators who have the ability to interact with colleagues, partners and customers in an effective, clear and constructive way.
   

  

 In addition to these abilities, we also want you to:
   

  

* Have a bachelor’s degree in business or a related field
* Have proven work experience as a Sales Representative or Key Account Manager in IT (solution selling) or in defence industry (counter surveillance)
* Be fluent in Swedish/Dutch and English language
* Be highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
* Have excellent selling/presentation, negotiation and communication skills
* Have time management and organizational skills
* Have the ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
* Have relationship management skills and openness to feedback


**Other information:**
 For this position you need a Swedish or Dutch citizenship.
   

  

 We will look at applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.

title: GRC Specialist (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Security Department oversees security, governance, risk management, and compliance, and security operations for all Agoda. We are vigilant in ensuring there is no breach or vulnerability threatening our company or endangering our employees to keep Agoda safe and protected. Given that the security ecosystem is moving forward at tremendous speed, we like to be early adaptors of recent technology and products. This would be a great challenge for those who want to work with the best technology in a dynamic and advanced environment.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 We are seeking a dedicated professional with experience in GRC (Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance). The ideal candidate will collaborate with internal stakeholders to manage Information Security and compliance risks.
 **We prioritize strong communication skills and the ability to multitask effectively** 
 . In this role, you will be expected to work on various tasks like Crisis Management, Risk Management and other GRC functions.
   

  

 The role will require and independent pro-active thinker, strong stakeholder management, and natural team player.
   

  

**This position is open to both local and international candidates with relocation support available for eligible candidates to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
**In this Role, you will get to:**
* Clear concepts of Risk Management, GRC functions and industry level frameworks & standards like NIST CSF etc
* Ability to consistently assess risks and regular awareness to ensure IT policy, procedures, guidelines, and standards are implemented in the day-to-day operations.
* Delivers high quality work in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision
* Work with internal teams for maturity of security controls
* Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate and communicate during incidents and events, while working to enhance crisis management processes and procedures
* Track and ensure adequate and timeley resolution to all audit and risk assessment findings or issues relating to information security, and never miss a deadline
* Proactively and effectively communicates any gaps or improvements, both internally and externally, through written and verbal communication


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Business, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or equivalent professional experience
* 2-4 years of experience working in a technology role, preferably in a security background.
* Strong understanding of international Information Security standards
* The ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and balance conflicting demands
* Comfortable analyzing operational and technical data, working under pressure and meeting deadlines
* Independent self-starter, problem-solving mindset, team player and ability to multi-task
* Strong communication, including presentation skills, able to convey complex concepts to a variety of audiences
* Strong project management skills
* The flexibility to make quick decisions as disasters change and develop


**It’s great if you have:** 
  

  

- Experience leading global projects across different locations

- Individuals must have IT-related experience demonstrating each of the four competencies listed below:

* Attention to Detail – Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail
* Stakeholder management – Works with clients and leadership
* Oral Communication – Expresses information to individuals or groups effectively
* Problem Solving – Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information
* Relocation package is provided in case you prefer to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand. Our benefits are…
* Hybrid Working Model
* WFH Set Up Allowance
* 30 Days of Remote Working from anywhere globally every year
* Employee discount for accommodation globally
* Global team of 90+ nationalities
* 40+ offices and 25+ countries
* Annual CSR / Volunteer Time off
* Benevity Subscription for employee donations
* Volunteering opportunities globally
* Free Headspace subscription
* Free Odilo & Udemy subscriptions
* Access to Employee Assistance Program (third party for personal and workplace support)
* Enhanced Parental Leave
* Life, TPD & Accident Insurance

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

title: HR-Generalist to Billerud headquarters
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a global, market-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are now looking for a HR-Generalist**
**All applications to this process should be sent to our partner**
 We can offer you an exciting HR- Generalist role where you will have the opportunity to work with business-oriented HR in an international organization where HR holds a strong mandate. In this role, you will report to Senior HR Manager for Commercial & Group Functions and become part of an engaged HR team characterized by collaboration and knowledge sharing.
   

  

 In this role, you will support the Commercial division and Group Functions such as Legal, Sustainability, Finance and Special Projects with the full spectrum of HR matters. As an HR- Generalist, you will develop and implement Billerud's personnel strategy in line with the company’s overall strategy and goals. You will be part of an international HR - team and work closely with the functions where you will contribute with both operational and strategic perspectives.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Collaborate with managers within Commercial and Group Functions to drive the People agenda and achieve effective results within the organization.
* Work closely with the business and integrate business perspectives and business goals into decision-making within HR.
* Act as a sounding board for the leaders and implement HR processes throughout the year (personnel matters, recruitment, labor law, employee engagement surveys, talent and succession management, performance management, compensation & benefits, development programs, etc.).
* Train leaders in sustainable leadership and encourage them to set direction and unlock the potential of all employees.
* Provide expertise on legal requirements related to the day-to-day management of employees, collaborating with our union partners.


 The position is based at Billerud's headquarters in Solna.
   

  

 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* Minimum 2 years of experience in a broad and business-oriented HR role, preferably within a larger international organization.
* You hold a university degree in HR, psychology, social sciences, business administration, or other related fields of study.
* You are fluent in both Swedish and English, in speech and writing.
* You possess knowledge of Swedish labor law and have participated in negotiations.
* You have experience working with all processes in the HR annual cycle and have driven change projects.
* You are accustomed to working in business-oriented environments and able to prioritize accordingly.


 Additionally, you have experience in stakeholder management and the ability to collaborate with managers both remotely in other parts of the country and on-site at the headquarters. A background in recruitment is a plus.
   

  

**Personal qualities**
 For us, your personality is important. To succeed in this role, we believe you are a humble, curious, and solution-oriented person who works proactively to build trust and relationships within the organization. You should enjoy working operationally and close to the business, with the ability to prioritize and a strong drive for execution. We are looking for someone with high energy who is a strong collaborator with a "team before self" mindset.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: Place customer in center, dare to innovate, lead the change and care for each other.
   

  

**Contact**
 All applications to this process should be sent to our partner &Partner.
   

  

 We will be working continuously with selection and interviews, so please submit your application as soon as possible. The position is full-time, and the starting date is by agreement. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact the responsible consultant at &Partners, Sofia Cohn, at 0735-216 579 or sofia.cohn@andpartners.se.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2024-09-27.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
**Billerud is a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials.** 
 We dare to innovate and put our customers in the center by developing sustainable alternatives that challenge the conventional in the packaging industry. Our commitment goes beyond products; it's about reshaping the way businesses and consumers perceive and use packaging to minimize environmental impact.
   

  

**We care for our people.** 
 Billerud is an international company with local roots. No matter where you work, we take pride in always making safety our number one priority.
   

  

**Realize your true value.** 
 At Billerud we lead the change in everything that we do. We have a strong focus on growth and development, offering diverse opportunities for employees to evolve professionally and personally.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: e-Invoicing Regulatory Counsel - Partner management
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You'll Do**
 The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.
   

  

**More Specifically You Will**
* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.


**What We Need From You**
* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.


**What Does Sovos Offer You?**
 The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!
   

  

* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits


*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*
**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Sales Account Executive
description:
**Large Company With Great Ambitions And Close Relations**
 efficy is a leading European Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solution that provides businesses of all sizes with complete, flexible, customizable, and scalable software to enable their growth. efficy’s platform includes products for marketing automation, sales, project management, customer service, and customer nurturing. Currently, more than 300,000 users from 63 countries use efficy’s tool.
   

  

 Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Brussels, efficy’s around 500 employees work in local offices in Belgium, France, Spain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Warsaw, Hong Kong, or remotely.
   

  

 Our mission is to contribute to the success of every company by helping them transform customer data into customer insight while simplifying the work of their employees.
   

  

 At efficy, two days are rarely the same, and things are changing rapidly. So, fasten your seat belt, and join us on the journey.
   

  

**A Unique Work Experience & Company Culture**
 We want our employees to thrive in their daily lives, and therefore you can expect challenges, online music quizzes, onsite ping-pong tournaments, and lots more. Communication is informal, and your colleagues are only a short call away.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 As a Sales Account Executive, you will work directly with small and medium-sized enterprises in Sweden, helping them grow and expand their businesses. You will manage inbound leads while also creating new business opportunities through outbound sales efforts. You will sell both our CRM and Mar-Tech solutions. Please note that you will focus solely on acquiring new logos, as existing clients are managed by a separate team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Execute complete sales cycles, consistently meeting or surpassing quarterly targets for new business.
* Source potential prospects through your own outbound activities.
* Conduct qualification discussions with senior executives and department leaders.
* Conduct online product demonstrations and occasionally arrange in-person presentations.
* Identify client needs and develop strategies to meet them.
* Navigate sales through internal advocates to multiple decision-makers, including C-level executives.
* Coordinate with internal stakeholders, such as the Projects, Customer Success, and Security teams, to address client needs and respond to inquiries.


**About YOU**
* Strong sales skills with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in high-volume transactional sales with B2B clients.
* Experience in the CRM/Martech/SaaS industry is a plus.
* Native-level fluency in Swedish and good command of English.
* Quota-driven and experienced in creating and managing high-performing sales funnels.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with a passion for acquiring new logos.
* Excellent presentation and listening skills.
* Strong engagement and sense of ownership.
* Ability to collaborate and influence in a “win as a team” environment.
* Resourceful and seen as a trusted advisor to customers and colleagues.


**We offer YOU**
* A competitive salary package with a bonus system and a referral program
* A stable and growing company with an entrepreneurial mindset where we will listen to your ideas and support you to make it happen
* High flexibility and hybrid work is part of our DNA
* International growing opportunities and internal mobility
* Events: team lunches, after work, sports, trips
* Learning opportunities: languages, tech, product, sales techniques, leadership


*efficy is a people-first employer. We offer equal opportunities to all our candidates. We pride ourselves on the diversity of our people. We welcome you, and everything that makes you—well, you. That includes your gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status. So, if you’re interested in joining us, please feel free to apply. We can’t wait to meet* 
*you!*
**Disclaimer**
 efficy is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at efficy via email, the Internet, or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of efficy. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by efficy as a result of an unsolicited referral or through other means.

title: Global Operations Specialist - Parental leave cover
description:
We are now looking for a Global Operations Specialist for the Wholesale department at our head office in Stockholm. Are you driven by working with a strong brand, having a large degree of autonomy, and want to be part of a growing team? Then this is the role for you.
   

  

 This is a fixed-term position covering a parental leave until October 1, 2025.
   

  

**About The Position**
 In this role, you will oversee global wholesale operations, ensuring efficiency, quality, and alignment with our strategic goals. The role involves close collaboration with multiple departments and a strong focus on optimizing processes, customer service, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement within the organization.
   

  

**Areas of responsibility**
* Develop and implement operational policies and procedures to improve efficiency and productivity.
* Oversee daily operations to ensure the seamless functioning of all business units, including design, production, logistics, and retail.
* Address customer inquiries related to product information, order status, returns, exchanges, and shipping.
* Maintain a strong understanding of current product lines, trends, and inventory to provide accurate information to customers.
* Assist customers with order placement, modifications, cancellations, and tracking information.
* Collaborate with warehouse and logistics teams to ensure timely fulfillment of customer orders.
* Work closely with sales, marketing (Key Account Trade Marketing), and merchandising teams to align customer support strategies and initiatives.
* Support the sales team with order management.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 We are looking for someone with a relevant education in business, logistics, marketing, or equivalent work experience. You have at least 3 years of experience in a similar role, with strong strategic and analytical skills. If you have experience in the end-to-end supply chain process within the fashion industry, it is meritorious. Good knowledge of Swedish and English, both spoken and written, is required.
   

  

**Your future workplace**
 Step into the world of Lexington, where we proudly highlight our core values:
 **Together, Courage, and Determination** 
 . Lexington is a premium lifestyle brand offering both Home and Clothing collections. Your initiative and drive are valuable to us. You'll become part of a team where innovation and creativity are in focus. By combining our strengths, courage, and determination, we foster a culture where every individual can grow and contribute to our shared success.
   

  

 We value the qualities that a balanced age and gender distribution, as well as ethnic and cultural diversity, bring to our organization. Our ambition is to recruit employees with diverse backgrounds to reflect our society and our customers.
   

  

**Join Us Today**
 Do not hesitate to submit your application! We will be interviewing continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 This is a fixed-term position covering a parental leave until October 1, 2025. We offer a flexible working environment. Your primary workplace will be at Lexington's inspiring head office on Sankt Eriksgatan in Fridhemsplan.
   

  

**We are excited to have you on board!**

title: Ingenjörer för kommande konsultuppdrag
description:
*Är du en ingenjör som letar efter en utvecklande roll på ett spännande företag? Vi ser ett behov av ingenjörer inom flera teknikområden. Tillsättningar sker löpande där vi matchar dig mot rätt uppdrag. Varmt välkommen med din spontanansökan!* 




  





 Vi har ett stort behov av tekniskt kunniga individer som är drivna och har en stark känsla av engagemang.
 



  





**Vi har uppdrag till dig som vill arbeta som:** 



* Mjukvaruingenjör
* Systemingenjör
* Hårdvaruingenjör
* Konstruktör
* Produktionsingenjör
* Systemutvecklare



  





 Uppdraget kommer initialt vara ett konsultuppdrag med anställning hos oss på Skill, med möjlighet att senare bli anställd direkt hos någon av våra kunder i Stockholmsregionen.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är högskoleingenjör eller civilingenjör som är relevant för ovan nämnda positioner. Arbetslivserfarenhet ser vi som starkt meriterande!
 



 Som person är du ambitiös och fortsatt nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker. Du har ett starkt intresse för teknik och trivs med tekniska utmaningar. Du är strukturerad och analytisk i ditt arbetssätt.
 



  





 Exempel på utbildningar vi ser som extra intressanta:
 



 • Flyg- och rymdteknik
 



 • Teknisk mekanik
 



 • Marina system
 



 • Datateknik
 



 • Systemutveckling
 



 • Elektroteknik
 



 • Mekatronik
 



  





 Det är också viktigt att du har förmågan att arbeta effektivt i grupp, är positivt inställd och visar ett stort engagemang gentemot de uppgifter du får. Kommunikationsförmåga och serviceinriktning är nödvändiga egenskaper då arbetsuppgifterna innebär kontakt med både interna och externa parter. Du kan kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
 



  





 Vi anställer även underkonsulter.
 



  





 Tjänster hos vissa av våra kunder kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där företaget har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
 



  





**Ansökningsförfarande** 




 Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din spontanansökan så snart som möjligt. Urvalsarbete sker löpande, vi kontaktar dig om din profil möter kraven för något av kundens uppdrag.
 



 Detta är en spontanansökan, vilket gör att återkoppling på din ansökan kan dröja.
 



 Vid frågor vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Isabelle Wallin, isabelle.wallin@skill.se eller 013-4958817.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Skill är ett modernt kompetensföretag med ett brett tjänsteutbud inom rekrytering, bemanning, hr-tjänster och kompetensutveckling. Vi har en stark kundbas i teknik- och industriföretag samt inom IT och tech.
 



 Rätt människor, på rätt plats, kan förändra allt – och när människor växer, växer företag.
 



 People change – everything.

title: Sales Executive
description:
**Are you passionate about Sales and want to make an impact?** 




 Academic Positions is a leading digital recruitment marketing and employer branding services provider for the global academic and research community. With over 14 years of experience, we have proudly partnered with more than 2,500 universities and research institutes across 60 countries to attract exceptional talent. Our comprehensive solutions include job advertising, social media campaigns, and content marketing on academicpositions.com, as well as through external digital channels.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As a Senior Sales Executive at Academic Positions, your primary objective will be to drive revenue growth through the sale of premium subscription and customized solutions. Using our full talent-attraction and employer branding offering, you will establish new and sustainable partnerships with universities and research institutes worldwide. You will book and lead meetings with key stakeholders, build relationships, and identify high-potential business opportunities.
 



  





**What You'll Do and How You'll Make an Impact:** 




 The Sales team is a key contributor to growth and culture at Academic Positions. Our mission is to help our clients’ reach their goals by delivering best-in-class solutions with unparalleled professionalism, integrity, and passion for recruitment marketing and employer branding in higher education.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Build Relationships:** 
 Develop connections with decision-makers and C-level executives at major universities and research institutes to understand their needs and communicate our unique selling proposition.
* **Expand Client Base:** 
 Efficiently manage all aspects of the sales cycle from prospecting to integrating, aiming to grow our client base.
* **Generate Opportunities:** 
 Follow up on leads, conduct research, and tap into your existing network to generate new business development opportunities.
* **Collaborate Closely:** 
 Work with our technical and account management teams to ensure superior performance of our solutions.
* **Develop Knowledge:** 
 Gain professional technical knowledge of our solutions and stay updated on developments in recruitment marketing to design strategies that fulfill client needs.
* **Report Progress:** 
 Regularly report on the progress of sales processes regarding both existing and potential clients.



  





**Desired Skills and Experience:** 



* Ability to understand customers’ needs and translate them into profitable solutions.
* Proven ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders.
* Outstanding track record of success in finding new prospects, growing relationships, and consistently hitting KPIs in mid to longer-term sales cycles.
* Highly developed analytical skills with the ability to quickly absorb and act on information.
* Self-motivated, positive individual with an entrepreneurial mindset and achiever attitude.
* Demonstrated ability to forecast sales and build sales plans.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, additional Scandinavian languages are a plus.



  





 We know that culture plays a vital role in the success of any company. That's why we frequently organize social activities such as winner dinners, team breakfasts, Friday fika and occasional barbeques on our massive patio. These events are always a hit with everyone. Additionally, our office's central location in Stockholm makes it convenient to access a variety of excellent lunch and after-work spots nearby.
 



 Learn more about our team, people, and values at weare.academicpositions.com.
 



  





**Join Us:** 




 Are you ready to take on this challenging and rewarding role? Join our dynamic and international team at Academic Positions and contribute to our mission of connecting top academic talent with leading universities and research institutes worldwide. Apply now and be part of our success story!
 



  





 We evaluate candidates on an ongoing basis so we recommend that you apply early. We aim to respond to suitable candidates within 3 working days and an assessment is part of our selection procedure.
 



  





**Duration** 




 Permanent
 



  





**Working hours** 




 Full time
 



  





**Employer** 




 Academic Media Group International AB
 



  





**Office location** 




 Kungsgatan 60, 111 22, Stockholm
 



  





**Website** 




 www.academicpositions.com
 



  





**Contact person** 




 Jonas Marin
 



 jonas.marin@academicpositions.com

title: Senior lösningsarkitekt till Combitech i Stockholm
description:
**Combitech växer och vi söker nu innovativa och drivna seniora lösningsarkitekter som är redo att forma framtiden tillsammans med oss. Är du affärsdriven med erfarenhet och intresse kring teknik och har en talang för att skapa robusta och hållbara lösningar? Då kan det vara just dig vi letar efter!**
**Som senior lösningsarkitekt hos Combitech kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i våra kunduppdrag. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för att utveckla arkitekturen för komplexa system som möter våra kunders unika behov och utmaningar. Din expertis kommer att bidra till att leda vägen för innovation, samtidigt som du säkerställer att lösningarna är säkra, skalbara och effektiva. På Combitech har vi en företagskultur som värderar innovation och hållbarhet, och där det finns mycket utrymme för personlig och professionell utveckling. Vi har höga ambitioner men vi värdesätter även en balans mellan arbete och fritid. Hos oss ska du kunna prestera både på och utanför jobbet.**
 I den här rollen får du möjlighet att:
   

  

* Samarbeta med projektledare, utvecklare och andra stakeholders för att säkerställa teknisk kvalitet och integration
* Analysera och förstå kundkrav för att designa bästa möjliga lösning
* Utforma teknisk arkitektur för systemlösningar
* Jobba med omvärldsbevakning kring tekniska trender och bästa praxis
* Jobba med riskhantering inom teknisk design och implementering
* Dokumentera och presentera arkitekturen för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, högskole- eller civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av systemarkitektur
* Är bekant med molnlösningar, API:er och integrationsplattformar
* Har erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* Är en utmärkt kommunikatör och kan förmedla komplexa idéer på ett enkelt sätt
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift


**Om försvarssekretess: Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**
**Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Kom & gör skillnad
   

  

 Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.
   

  

 För oss handlar det om hållbarhet - vi vill bli branschens mest hållbara företag; och för att vara ett hållbart företag i en hållbar framtid behöver vi investera i våra medarbetare. För oss är din återhämtning, dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din trygghet lika viktigt som företagets framgång - utan våra medarbetare står vi stilla.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in våra karriärsidor!**
 Kontaktperson/rekryterande chef: Helena Hagberg +46 (73) 4469172

title: Regional HR Manager - EMEA
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Regional
 **HR Manager** 
 at Canonical to support our EMEA region.
   

  

 With 1,100+ colleagues across 75 countries, we require an HR function that thinks and acts globally. We're looking for a regional lead that will report into our Global Head of HR who can help build our company as we go through continued growth plans. It's an exciting time to join with the opportunity to help shape and create an HR function for the future. You will lead the EMEA team of HR professionals to provide precise, compliant and scalable HR operations to the business, advise and execute on HR issues across the whole employee life-cycle, and partner with senior leadership in your region. You will have an analytical approach, a keen eye for detail and the ability to interpret data trends and themes.
   

  

 The role entails the individual to:
   

  

* Lead and scale Canonical's regional HR team (1-4 direct reports, depending on region)
* Deliver precise and compliant HR operations in a timely manner and with the highest degree of accuracy
* Interact closely with Talent Science and Workplace Engineering teams and create tight-knit processes across all HR regions
* Be accountable for HR processes such as talent development, succession planning, performance assessments, onboarding, culture and engagement initiatives that drive high performing teams
* Work with senior managers across the business on performance management, organizational design, employee engagement, rewards- and workforce planning
* Coach and advise people managers on the full spectrum of employee relations issues across multiple countries
* Partner with people managers to support the delivery of appropriate training and development programs
* Establish a trusted partnership with the business in your region
* Drive diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives
* Design new policies and deliver on business-critical HR related projects globally
* Present at Canonical events to articulate Canonical's HR practices


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* HR experience leading initiatives across regions within a technology business
* People management experience
* Experience in business partnering with senior stakeholders
* A good balance between leading and executing, in this role you will need to be hands-on involved in the daily HR routines, too
* Experience in working in a remote first organization
* Able to leverage data to make informed decisions
* Knowledge and practical implementation of HR practices and employment law across EMEA
* Fluent in business English (written and spoken)
* Self motivated, organized, accurate, confident, authentic, results-orientated, open-minded, enthusiastic and energetic
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Experience with immigration policies and mobility processes
* Professional HR qualification (CIPD/SHRM or other)
* Facilitation skills


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Information Security Coordinator
description:
**About Scania Finans**
 Scania Finans AB is a financial company within the business area Traton Financial Services. With a customer financing portfolio exceeding 23 billion SEK, Scania Finans AB is one of the largest financial companies within Scania. The company has approximately 100 employees, with half located at the headquarters in Södertälje and the rest in Denmark, Norway, Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, and Sweden.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced and motivated
 **Information Security Coordinator** 
 to join our team! In this role, you will have a crucial responsibility in driving our information security initiatives, ensuring compliance with the
 **DORA** 
 (Digital Operational Resilience Act), and providing key ICT (Information and Communication Technology) competence in various projects. You will also manage our
 **yearly cycle of information security activities** 
 to keep our organization resilient against cyber threats.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Operational Implementation of DORA: Ensure compliance with the Digital Operational Resilience Act, working on policy development, control implementation, and regular audits.
* ICT Expertise in Projects: Serve as the information security subject matter expert in development projects, ensuring security is embedded into all aspects of system and process development.
* Yearly Security Activity Cycle: Drive the annual cycle of security-related tasks, including risk assessments, incident response drills, security awareness training, and audit preparation.
* Risk Management: Identify, assess, and mitigate risks related to information security and IT infrastructure.
* Collaboration Across Teams: Work closely with IT, legal, and business teams to ensure security measures align with organizational goals and regulatory requirements.
* Monitoring & Reporting: Continuously monitor compliance and prepare regular reports on security incidents, risk status, and improvement measures.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone with a strong background in information security, particularly in regulatory compliance and ICT security projects. You should be organized, proactive, and able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Experience in Information Security: A minimum of 3-5 years in information security roles, ideally with experience in financial services or regulated industries.
* DORA Knowledge: Understanding of the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) and experience in applying regulatory frameworks to operational security tasks.
* ICT Project Experience: Proven track record of working within ICT projects, ensuring security standards and best practices are maintained.
* Risk Management & Compliance: Experience with risk management processes, regulatory compliance, and security frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.).
* Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex security issues to diverse stakeholders.
* Certifications: Relevant security certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, or equivalent) are a plus.


**What We Offer**
* Career Development: Opportunities for professional growth and development in a fast-paced, evolving regulatory environment.
* Dynamic Team: Join a collaborative and motivated team, focused on protecting the organization’s digital resilience.
* Flexibility & Benefits: We offer a competitive salary, benefits package, and flexibility in working arrangements.


**Application**
 Your application shall include a personal letter and CV as well as copies of any relevant certificates. Apply no later than October 6. We look forward to your application!
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Embedded Test & Validation Engineer
description:
Do you want to be part of our technological journey towards electrification, development of autonomous vehicles and much more? We are looking for a skilled Test Engineer to join Alten Sweden! As part of our team, you will have a chance to grow, explore new technologies and your own capabilities.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 At ALTEN, every individual is equally valuable in building tomorrow’s world today. We meet future challenges by supporting our clients’ projects and enabling our people to reach their full potential. We do so by offering technological challenges, fulfilling opportunities, inspiring togetherness and the possibility to contribute to a sustainable future.
 



  





 We are convinced that your development is driven by your passion. By being active in several different industries, we can offer a wide range of assignments and an opportunity to influence both the world around you and your own development. With a coaching leadership, our leaders will guide you in the right direction. We also offer personalized training opportunities through your individual training budget, which you can use in our internal ALTEN Academy or on external courses.
 



  





 At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





**Your role as Embedded Test & Validation Engineer** 




 As an Embedded Test & Validation Engineer you will be involved within the entire software validation and verification process in areas such as
 *automotive,* 
*defense and aerospace, battery management systems,* 
 etc.
 



  





 As a test engineer, your daily work is to:
 


* Analyze requirements and write test cases
* Perform manual or automated tests
* Perform tests in SIL and HIL environment
* Create Test automation scripts
* Analysis of results and bug reporting



  





 The work can be done both on-site and in our inhouse projects for our major international clients within the
 ***area***
 situated in the Stockholm region.
 



  





**Who we are looking for** 




 We are looking for both
 *Junior* 
 as well as more
 *Senior engineers* 
 . Depending on your background and interest the role can vary from test & validation to also include technical lead. Having a genuine interest and experience with development and testing of embedded systems is something we value highly.
 



  





 It is a wide a very interesting field so we see that you can come from many different backgrounds. Feel free to reach out to the recruitment team with any questions.
 



*Embedded Test & Validation Engineer* 
**-** 
 We think that you have a strong testing background from Automotive, Railing, Telecom or other relevant industry.
 



  




* You typically have a good programming experience within Python, Java or C#.
* Previous experience from testing in HiL or SiL environment.
* It is meriting with experience from of CAN, CANOE / CANalyzer or similar tools.
* Meriting with previous experience from setting up test benches.



  





*Test Automation Engineer* 
**–** 
 You have previous experience from setting up and managing test pipelines as well as developing test cases and test framework. You likely have a good knowledge of Jenkins, Selenium and CI/CD. An ISTBQ certification is meriting.
 



  





*Functional Safety Verification Engineer* 

 –
 
 For this role you have a good understanding on
 *ISO-26262* 
 test process, methods and how to apply it. In your role you will support the system, hardware and software teams with Functional Safety related tests, but it could also include analysis on FuSa requirements. It is meriting to have experience from
 *DOORS* 
 or other Requirements management tools as well as
 *Function Safety Certification* 
 .
 



  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 57,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1500 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.
 



  





 For four years in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities. Welcome to read more about us at alten.se.

title: Azure tekniker
description:
Är det du vi söker?
   

  

 Som Azure Cloud Tekniker hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vårt team, arbeta nära våra kunder och arkitekter i en mängd olika och stimulerande projekt. Din uppgift blir att medverka i leveransen av molnbaserade infrastrukturlösningar. Tillsammans med våra arkitekter kommer du att bygga, implementera och förbättra Azure-baserade lösningar, såsom att flytta applikationer och hantera andra delar av projekt och kunduppdrag. Du och ditt team ansvarar för att implementera nya funktioner och tekniska lösningar inom Azure för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vad vi förväntar oss av dig:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur, med fokus på Azure eller andra molnlösningar.
* Teknisk kompetens inom Microsofts infrastruktur- och plattformstjänster i Azure.
* Van att arbeta med IT-infrastruktur och molnlösningar.
* Förmåga att kommunicera väl på engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror på för att trivas i rollen:
   

  

* En proaktiv och positiv inställning.
* Starkt intresse för Azure, med en önskan att ständigt lära och utvecklas.
* Förmågan att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Ansvarsfullhet och en positiv syn på samarbete.
* Entusiasm för att utforska och implementera nya lösningar.
* Motiveras av projekt som gör skillnad för både företaget och kunderna.


 Om B3 Cloud: Som experter på molnteknik och framtidens digitala arbetsplats, assisterar vi våra kunder i att övergå från traditionell infrastruktur till molnet. Vi erbjuder analyser, planering, migrering och förvaltning av IT-miljöer. Vi hjälper även kunder att uppnå modern samverkan och effektiv informationsdelning med Microsoft 365. B3 Cloud är en stolt Guldpartner och Cloud Service Provider (CSP) till Microsoft.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Kände du igen dig i beskrivningen och är redo för en ny utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan nu och låt oss berätta varför B3 borde vara din nästa arbetsgivare! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post, men vid frågor, kontakta Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om förmånerna hos oss? Här är några:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön.
* Frihet att styra din egen arbetsdag.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
* Interna utbildningar genom Cloud Skolan.
* Årliga konferensresor, sommar- och julfester.
* Regelbundna sociala aktiviteter, allt från After Works till frisbeegolf.


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
*Som en del av B3-koncernen, är B3 Cloud rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord: erfarenhet, mångfald och energi, och satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.*

title: Erfaren Nätverkstekniker
description:
OM JOBBET
 
 Som Nätverkstekniker kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa, implementera och underhålla avancerade nätverkslösningar för våra kunder. Du kommer att vara involverad i projektstyrda arbeten, från designfas till drift och underhåll av aktiva kommunikationsnät, inklusive switching, routing, brandväggar och trådlösa nätverk.
   

 Precis som vi, så är du en innovativ och ärlig lagspelare som vill ha kul tillsammans på jobbet. Du ansvarar för dina egna kunder, driftavtal och leveranser samtidigt som du samarbetar med övriga kollegor och partners. Med din hjälp säkerställer vi att våra kunder får den bästa lösningarna inom säker infrastruktur. Avdelningen har 24/7 jour året runt.
 



 Har ett stort eget driv och engagemang för att driva våra kunders utveckling samt är genuint intresserad av IT- och nätverk och har god teknisk förståelse
   




 ARBETSUPPGIFTER
   


 Vi jobbar i team på projektuppdrag mot kund. Det kan inkludera design, projektering, installation, felsökning, drift och underhåll och nyinstallation av kommunikationsnät.
 


* Dokumentation av arbete/projekt.
* Effektivisering och förbättringsförslag.
* Ansvar för kunders leveransförväntningar.


 ERFARENHETER OCH EGENSKAPER 
 * Gedigen kunskap inom LAN/WAN, switching/routing, felsökning, nätanalys, brandväggar, Wifi.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och genomföra konfigurationer av nät och aktiva komponenter.
* Gärna certifieringar inom Aruba, Fortinet, Juniper och Cisco eller har motsvarande kompetens.
* Affärsmässigt uppträdande gentemot kund.
* Gedigna kunskaper i det svenska och engelska språket.



 Vi ser gärna att du har körkort.
   

  




**ÖVRIGT** 

 Om du är nätverkstekniker och gillar att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med teknik så tveka inte att höra av dig, skicka in din ansökan idag!
 


**OM D-SOURCE** 

*Your source to IT*
 D-Source är ett modernt konsultbolag med bredden mellan helpdesk, infrastruktur och Tech. Vi har lång erfarenhet av att förstå kunders IT-behov! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du är intresserad av att ta reda på mer.
 



 Vad kan vi göra för dig och vad kan vi göra tillsammans?
 



  




**INGET JOBB FÖR DIG?** 

 Lugnt! Du kan alltid registrera dig förutsättningslöst på D-Source jobbsida genom att Connecta med oss. Då hamnar du i vår kandidatdatabas och får koll på våra kommande aktuella tjänster.

title: Business IT Analyst - Access Management CAD processes and systems
description:
Are you getting energy by understanding user needs? Are you enjoying team work? Have you heard that you are good in communication? Do you have knowledge about product development and Access Management? Then you might be our new colleague!
   

  

**About Us**
 Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 The trucks, buses and power solutions in these transport solutions are developed in our CAD platform by the designers at our R&D departments. Our aim is to create the best possible experience for our users. We put the user in the centre when we develop our methods, processes and the CAD platform. Our organisation is responsible for strategy, methods and tools for the virtual description of Scania’s products. We work together with business and IT in a Value Creation Team (VCT), where we also have members from other brands in our Traton family.
   

  

 For us it is important with an sustainable mindset, our company culture with our core values are close to our hearts and supports our customers, people and our planet.
   

  

**About The Assignments**
 We are looking for a Business IT Analyst to the team working with Access Management in our CAD/vPDM system.
   

  

 The information in our system should be accessible for different user categories in different countries according to pre-defined conditions such as demands from information owners in the line organisation, Scania´s information security organisation, legal demands as well as Export control regulations.
   

  

 The assignment is about understanding the users and their needs as well as the access regulations, document and describe the requirements to the rest of the team and together find suitable solutions. It includes also testing, preparing education material and user instructions.
   

  

 You will be a part of a cross-functional team together with Product owner, Scrum master, Developers and System architects etc. You will work closely with users/stakeholders in Scania´s global organisation, system suppliers, your own team and other value creation teams. We are working in an agile way and plan our work together in ten weeks periods.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We believe that you are curious to understand the users behind the outspoken need, and you can easily understand legal demands that regulates information sharing in a global company.
   

  

  

* You have good communication skills, in both Swedish and English, and have the ability to explain the user demands to the developers, visualise and document the needs, create working methods, training material as well as user guides.
* It is valuable to have a helpful and proactive mindset, an ability to see the big picture and also to understand the different mechanisms that create the full solution for the users.
* You have an analytical way of thinking, an ability to find solutions that are best for the users as well as the maintainability of the system.


 In this role you will need to drive things forward in a smooth way and enjoy co-operating with others.
   

  

 We believe that you have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering or IT. Experience from access management and IT security work from a big global company are appreciated. It is an advantage if you are familiar with the product development process at Scania and PLM/CAD systems Catia, Enovia and 3DExperience from DS. It is great if you have experience in the Business Analyst role as well as agile way of working.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As an employee at Scania, in addition to career development, we also provide wellness allowance, company car, insurance, job express to Södertälje headquarters in around 30 mins from Stockholm Central or Liljeholmen exclusively for Scania employees, and subsidized lunch.
   

  

 We are sitting in nice newly renovated activity based office. We have possibility to work from home some days in a week if the work allows. We offer an inclusive workplace with people with different skills and background and with possibilities to personal development. The work/life balance is important for us.
   

  

**Further information**
 If you have questions, please contact Anne Thomasfolk (Head of CAD/vPDM, EYMDD) +46 73 655 2685.
   

  

**Application**
 Please send in your CV, letter and grade copies latest 2024-09-15. We will start to call for interviews before end of application date and interviews will be held continuously.
