* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2741382

title: Senior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. The Commercial Domain is a global team within TUI technology responsible for supporting the entire support and delivery of Commercial products. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Spain, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.
   

  

 At TUI we’re ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented and dedicated Senior Data Engineer to join the Commercial Analytics technology organisation.
   

  

 The
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 is a practitioner and an advocate of state-of-the-art data engineering practices. Working in an agile environment and keeping up with the ever-evolving technical landscape the
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 is a lifelong learner and likes to think outside the box.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 , you are a go-to person working as part of a cross-functional team or a practice team that enables data engineering skills and capabilities across a whole domain.
   

  

 Being an enthusiast in data engineering, with an advanced DevSecOps mindset, you:
   

  

* Use your excellent collaboration skills to work with your team to deliver the best answers to our customers’ needs with full responsibility for its data flows, from design to operation.
* Care diligently about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
* Use your deep technical skills to work closely with your colleagues to ensure an optimal data delivery architecture which is consistent throughout ongoing highly complex projects.
* Work on data collection, data pipelines, data delivery to other systems and building an advanced core data warehouse.
* Support your fellow Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data engineering tasks and work as a team to deliver data driven solutions. With your advanced skillset for understanding and solving problems you are able to take full ownership of complex topics or multi-faceted initiatives and outcomes panning across your domain.
* Are able to verbalise your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate ideas into outcomes.
* Research, evaluate and test new approaches, processes and tools (together with the domain’s teams as well as the Group Enabler teams) and help teams to use them effectively.
* Take part in Communities of Practice, including collaboration in shared initiatives to grow your experience.
* Regularly coach, guide and develop more junior colleagues.


 Additionally, you love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for technical excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level.  You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas.
   

  

 Security is part of everyone’s job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
* Experienced in design, implementation and use of different database structures;
* Outstanding SQL, data profiling & Analytics language skills (e.g. Snowflake and Python);
* Advanced experience with building ETL/ELT pipelines;
* Strong hands-on experience with modern data storage systems (e.g. AWS S3);
* Experience of using and building Reporting Tools (e.g, Tableau);
* On the spot conversion of high-level business & technical requirements into technical specs;
* Strong skillset in using cloud technologies (AWS preferred);
* Compelling coaching and training skills for imparting professional software engineering skills;
* Understanding of social and ethical implications of software engineering (e.g. like described in the ACM Code of Ethics);
* You’re an open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner , you’re highly autonomous, and you’re comfortable with ambiguity.


**About Our Offer**
* Working in an international team who are working with forward thinking methodologies like Lean and Agile.
* Become a valued team member of TUI, the No.1 global and socially aware travel company.
* Develop yourself by working as part of an international team and through our free global learning and development programme including free language lessons and various Management Development Programmes.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

title: Senior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. The Commercial Domain is a global team within TUI technology responsible for supporting the entire support and delivery of Commercial products. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Spain, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.
   

  

 At TUI we’re ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.
   

  

 We are looking for a talented and dedicated Senior Data Engineer to join the Commercial Analytics technology organisation.
   

  

 The
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 is a practitioner and an advocate of state-of-the-art data engineering practices. Working in an agile environment and keeping up with the ever-evolving technical landscape the
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 is a lifelong learner and likes to think outside the box.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 , you are a go-to person working as part of a cross-functional team or a practice team that enables data engineering skills and capabilities across a whole domain.
   

  

 Being an enthusiast in data engineering, with an advanced DevSecOps mindset, you:
   

  

* Use your excellent collaboration skills to work with your team to deliver the best answers to our customers’ needs with full responsibility for its data flows, from design to operation.
* Care diligently about the quality of your work, including proper documentation and security aspects.
* Use your deep technical skills to work closely with your colleagues to ensure an optimal data delivery architecture which is consistent throughout ongoing highly complex projects.
* Work on data collection, data pipelines, data delivery to other systems and building an advanced core data warehouse.
* Support your fellow Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data engineering tasks and work as a team to deliver data driven solutions. With your advanced skillset for understanding and solving problems you are able to take full ownership of complex topics or multi-faceted initiatives and outcomes panning across your domain.
* Are able to verbalise your thoughts and ideas and take the initiative to translate ideas into outcomes.
* Research, evaluate and test new approaches, processes and tools (together with the domain’s teams as well as the Group Enabler teams) and help teams to use them effectively.
* Take part in Communities of Practice, including collaboration in shared initiatives to grow your experience.
* Regularly coach, guide and develop more junior colleagues.


 Additionally, you love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for technical excellence, ownership and self-organisation at team and personal level.  You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas.
   

  

 Security is part of everyone’s job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
* Experienced in design, implementation and use of different database structures;
* Outstanding SQL, data profiling & Analytics language skills (e.g. Snowflake and Python);
* Advanced experience with building ETL/ELT pipelines;
* Strong hands-on experience with modern data storage systems (e.g. AWS S3);
* Experience of using and building Reporting Tools (e.g, Tableau);
* On the spot conversion of high-level business & technical requirements into technical specs;
* Strong skillset in using cloud technologies (AWS preferred);
* Compelling coaching and training skills for imparting professional software engineering skills;
* Understanding of social and ethical implications of software engineering (e.g. like described in the ACM Code of Ethics);
* You’re an open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner , you’re highly autonomous, and you’re comfortable with ambiguity.


**About Our Offer**
* Working in an international team who are working with forward thinking methodologies like Lean and Agile.
* Become a valued team member of TUI, the No.1 global and socially aware travel company.
* Develop yourself by working as part of an international team and through our free global learning and development programme including free language lessons and various Management Development Programmes.


 We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

title: Support Specialist D365 F&O
description:
Är du serviceinriktad, har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och brinner du för nöjda kunder? Har du erfarenhet av att jobba med ERP-lösningar? Då kan det vara dig vi söker till rollen som Support Specialist!
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 I rollen som Support Specialist inom Dynamics Customer Success kommer du att vara vår single point of contact för samtliga kunders supportärenden. Du kommer vara en ”spindel i nätet” inom Customer Success organisationen där du har daglig dialog och kontakt med våra kunder. Du kommer jobba nära och ha en tät dialog med våra kundteam (service managers och konsulter) med syfte att ge bästa möjliga kundsupport och upplevelse.
   

  

**Exempel på dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera inkommande ärenden i Implemas kundportal
* Analys, felsökning samt rättning av enklare fel inom ditt kompetensområde
* Utföra service requests
* Eskalera ärenden om nödvändigt
* Delta i supportmöten
* Delaktig i att utveckla supportfunktionens arbetssätt, processer och våra tjänster


**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi lägger stort vikt vid din personlighet och tror att du kommer från konsultverksamhet eller arbetat hos kund inom linjeverksamhet. Eftersom merparten av våra supportärenden innefattar Dynamics 365 F&O bör du vara väl insatt och ha ett intresse för produkten och dess möjligheter. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av verktyg som exempelvis såsom JIRA, DevOps, Confluence etc.
   

  

 Som person tror vi att du är serviceinriktad, ansvarsfull och trivs som bäst i kontakten med kund. Givetvis är du kommunikativ och förstår vikten av tydlighet i varje dialog. Du motiveras av att arbeta i grupp och hitta synergier mellan olika kunder.
   

  

**Implema erbjuder dig**
 Välkommen in i en dynamisk organisation med en kultur och ett engagemang som kännetecknas av en stolthet och stark vilja att alltid driva arbetet framåt. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Du kommer få möjlighet att kontinuerligt utbilda, fortbilda och certifiera dig i relevanta lösningar.
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige. Idag är vi 200 medarbetare och omsätter 300 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Driftstekniker till IT operations
description:
Vill du ha meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter som gör skillnad i människors liv? Välkommen till kommunen som är långt ifrån lagom! Botkyrka kommun är den sjätte största kommunen i Stockholms län och består av kommundelarna Alby, Fittja, Hallunda, Norsborg, Tullinge, Tumba, Vårsta och Grödinge. Botkyrka kommun har cirka 95 000 invånare och drygt 6 400 medarbetare.
   

  

 Kommunstyrelseförvaltningen ansvarar för styrning, ledning och samordning i kommunen. Vi bidrar till att visioner och politiska beslut blir verklighet. Vi är drygt 250 medarbetare med specialistkunskaper inom bland annat ekonomi, HR, kommunikation, utveckling och förvaltning, digitalisering, juridik, platsutveckling och trygghets- och säkerhetsfrågor.
   

  

 Tjänsten och arbetsuppgifterna
   

  

 I Botkyrka kommun strävar vi ständigt efter att förstärka vår välfärdsleverans bland annat med hjälp av digitalisering. Avgörande för vår framgång är en tillförlitlig IT-drift, tekniska förutsättningar för verksamhetsnära digitalisering och en långsiktigt god IT-ekonomi.
   

  

 Enheten Digital Infrastruktur och Drift består idag av 25 medarbetare och ansvarar för drift, utveckling och IT-support av kommunens centrala infrastruktur. Vi söker en drifttekniker med flera års erfarenhet från drift av MS-produkter och tjänster, Azure, nätverk & säkerhet.
   

  

 Arbetsområdet för enheten spänner över alla kommunens verksamheter. Vi är en serviceorganisation med uppgift att stödja verksamheterna. Vårt mål är att ge verksamheterna den bästa möjliga servicen.
   

  

 Som drifttekniker kommer du att ansvara för att hantera och underhålla vår IT-infrastruktur. Tjänsten innebär att du gör installationer, konfigurationer och felsökningar. Även problemlösning och logganalys i komplexa miljöer ingår. Att dokumentera pågående och avslutade arbeten ser vi som en naturlig del av arbetet. Arbetet är omväxlande och för att lyckas i din roll arbetar du tillsammans med erfarna kollegor.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

 Vi kan erbjuda kvalificerade arbetsuppgifter i en relativt omfattande och komplicerad teknisk miljö med stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling för den som har ambitionen. Enheten Digital Infrastruktur och Drift genomgår en större transformationsresa. Vi har kommit en bra bit på väg och hoppas att du tillsammans med oss vill påverka och genomdriva förbättringar.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder flexibilitet med möjlighet till distansarbete ett par dagar i veckan men vår ambition är att vi också ses på kontoret i Tumba.
   

  

 Du som söker till oss
   

  

 För att nå framgång i den här rollen ser vi att du har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure och servicedrift.
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med Defender for Identity, Defender for Office 365, Defender for Cloud, Defender for Cloud Apps, Defender for Endpoint, AAD Identity Protection.
* grundläggande kunskaper i PowerShell.
* god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Azure AD Conditional Access.
* Microsoft PKI.
* Microsoft Exchange.
* Graph API.
* DevOps och GitHub.
* Azure Log Analytics.
* verktyg och plattformar som Docker-lösningar.
* certifikathantering.
* DNS.
* arbete med IT-säkerhet inom verksamhet med höga säkerhetskrav.


 Vi ser det även som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av kommunal verksamhet i en liknande roll.
   

  

 Du är strukturerad med förmåga att planera och lägga upp arbete på ett noggrant sätt.
   

  

 Du uppskattar att både självständigt och i samarbete med andra, anta utmaningar och förmedla lösningar. Detta innebär god förmåga att både sätta dig in i, och dokumentera, tekniska lösningar. Som person är du trygg i dig själv, har stor integritet och är naturligt säkerhetsmedveten. Du är en nyfiken och kreativ person som kan uppnå ett stort förtroende hos våra uppdragsgivare.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökning!
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Botkyrka | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: KS/2024:00576 | Kontakt: Maha Hameed 0735966352, | Facklig företrädare: Fackliga representanter nås via kommunens växel 08-53061000, | Publicerat: 2024-09-13 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-27

title: Systemutvecklare inom Java och .NET
description:
Är du en erfaren systemutvecklare med ett intresse för att arbeta med både Java och .NET? Vill du vara en del av ett team som utvecklar viktiga pensionslösningar för Sveriges kommuner och regioner? Sök denna roll och ta chansen att bidra till en långsiktig och hållbar affär på Skandia!
   

  

**Systemutvecklare | Skandia | Stockholm/ Sundsvall**
 Du kommer att ingå i vårt utvecklingsteam som bygger affärsstöd kopplat till verksamhetsområdet Offentlig Affär inom vår pensionslösning.
   

  

 Arbetet som systemutvecklare i vårt team är både varierande och dynamiskt, med en blandning av nyutveckling och förvaltning. Du kommer främst att arbeta med Katja-systemet, som är Java-baserat, men teamet kommer även på sikt att integrera och ta över förvaltningen av ett .NET-baserat webbgränssnitt. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe-ramverket, vilket inkluderar dagliga standups, retrospektiv och PI-planering.
   

  

 Som systemutvecklare kommer du att ha en central roll i utvecklingen och underhållet av dessa system.
   

  

 Teamet inom offentlig affär består idag av 11 medarbetare; systemutvecklare, verksamhetsutvecklare, testare, scrum master, arkitekt och PO. Teamet är spritt över våra kontor i Stockholm och Sundsvall, och vi arbetar tillsammans för att utveckla hållbara lösningar för den offentliga sektorn.
   

  

**Hos oss får du möjlighet att:**
* Utveckla Java-baserade applikationer och system.
* Arbeta med IntelliJ och Git för effektiv och samarbetsorienterad kodhantering.
* Jobba med Octopus Deploy och Azure DevOps för kontinuerlig uveckling.
* Aktiv medverkan i att förvalta och utveckla större systemområden.
* Bidra med komplexa försäkringslösningar till den offentliga sektorn.


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att:**
* Du är självgående, strukturerad och har en stark analytisk förmåga.
* Är en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta och dela med dig av din kunskap till dina kollegor och verksamheten.
* Förmågan att balansera kvalitet och leverans i ett högt tempo, med bibehållen struktur och kreativitet.


 ,
   

  

* Har flera års erfarenhet av javautveckling.
* Arbetat med ASP.NET Webforms
* Kunskap inom C#/ .NET framework och Visual Basic
* Har god kännedom och erfarenhet av att arbeta med IntelliJ och Git.
* Erfarenhet av SQL.
* Kan svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* God kunskap inom försäkring-/ pensionslösningar.
* Har jobbat enligt SAFE.
* Kunskap/erfarenhet från arbete enligt ITIL-ramverk.


 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Microsoft Security Specialist
description:
**About Us**



Integrity360 is an the largest independent cybersecurity provider in UK&I, with Security Operations Centers in Dublin & Sofia, employing 310+ employees, of which over 80% are technical. We help our clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats against the ever-evolving threat landscape. Our security first approach positions security as an enabler and empowers our clients to do business securely.

  

You would be joining Integrity360 at an immensely exciting time. In June 2021 the company received a strategic investment from August Equity (one of the UK’s most successful mid-market private equity firms). Our intention is to grow Integrity360 into the leading cyber services and solutions provider in Europe. The market for cybersecurity services has never been stronger and is growing at an aggressive rate. Integrity360 is one of the most respected and established service providers in the industry and is well positioned to achieve a market leadership position over the coming years. We believe we have significant opportunities for growth especially over the next 36 months. With the right levels of energy, tenacity and skill, your opportunity for personal success and contribution to our overall aspirations is considerable.

 **Job Role / Responsibilities**

  

The Technical consultant will work closely with the professional services and MDR teams to deliver growth and commercial success through working with and assisting in the Development of Integrity360’s Cybersecurity Services portfolio, and Managed Detection and Response in particular. We have a large portfolio of Endpoint protection vendors that we deliver Professional Services and training courses on. This individual will have a great understanding of cybersecurity needs and related solutions and managed services across its many domains and knows what excellence looks like to deliver on Enterprise customer expectations. In the past months we have built a very successful Microsoft Services Department that needs to be expanded due to customer demand specialising in Defender ATP and the M365 security stack. We have great demand from our customers to deploy Defender ATP and assistance in getting the most out of their M365\E5 product entitlement.

 **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Technical market research in the field of managed cyber security services, platforms, and solutions
* Assisting sales in winning deals, architecting deployments, and performing the technical delivery and training on the solutions.
* Technical input into business case development to justify proposed investments in managed services.
* Work with subject-matter experts in the business to build great services.
* Perform on site or remote assessments, consultancy and HLD and LLD design services featuring the M365 security stack, and more.

  


**Candidate requirements**

  

* Advanced Windows Server and Desktop operational and troubleshooting knowledge.
* Excellent understanding of Active Directory and Group Policy architecture
* Good knowledge of VMWare\HyperV, Azure
* Experience supporting and administration of Microsoft SQL, Microsoft Exchange, Exchange Online, Intune, Defender ATP and SCCM. M365 security stack consulting experience (Defender ATP all the way to Identity and Cloud is a must)
* Experience with Windows 7-11. Experience with Linux is a plus.
* Good understanding of TCP/IP networking.
* Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical personnel.
* Ability to manage client expectation.
* Ability to prioritise your own time.
* A real passion for technology.
* Excellent documentation skills.
* A sense of good customer service
* A strong team player
* Practical deployment, architecture, and consultative experience in scoping, installing, auditing, configuring, and training on the technical solutions mentioned in this document.
* Understanding of CASB, SSE, ZTNA, ATP, EDR, NDR, XDR, SOC, SIEM, SOAR, CNAP, DLP, NGAV, Web and Email security software, Vulnerability management, Mitre ATT&CK Framework Fundamentals, NIST / ISO/IEC 270001 Frameworks, HIPAA Governance Frameworks, GDPR Policy Frameworks, LM (Lockheed Martin) Cyber Kill Chain

  


**What you will bring to us:**

  

* Should have previous experience in professional services. managed security services, preferably in a next generation SOC environment or in an MSSP or MDR provider.
* Experience with Endpoint Security Implementation / Management
* Experience in Customer Service Environments
* Skills and experience in detection and response operations and services is a major plus.
* Good understanding of the security vendor and vendor category landscape
* Relevant Cyber Security certifications
* Initiative and focus on continuous improvement.
* Must be systems and process oriented, and a self-motivated learner.
* Experience with administering enterprise servers and other systems.
* Proficiency in all aspects of system administration and engineering of Microsoft technologies to deploy and maintain global infrastructure services in our enterprise with an emphasis on the platforms mentioned.

  


**Qualifications**

  

* Must be educated to degree level or similar
* CompTIA A+
* CompTIA N+
* CompTIA Security+
* Microsoft – MS-500
* Microsoft – AZ-500
* Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Intune / Endpoint Manager Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Active Directory Domain Administration
* Microsoft Azure Active Directory Management
* Microsoft Data Loss Protection Management / Configuration
* Microsoft PIM (Identity and Access Management Management) Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Security Centre Management / Configuration
* Microsoft Cloud App Security

  


**Additional Knowledge (will contribute to your application):**


* Trend, Trellix\Mcafee\Skyhigh, Carbon black, Varonis, CrowdStrike, Mimecast, Rapid 7, Qualys, Splunk, Vectra, CyberArk, Microsoft Sentinel, AZ-800, AZ-801, SC-100, SC-200, SC-400
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: Marknadsassistent
description:
*Bilmånsson är återförsäljare av Volvo, Renault, Dacia och Hyundai. Vi är idag ca 350 medarbetare och finns i Eslöv, Hörby, Ängelholm, Kristianstad, Sjöbo, Ystad, Simrishamn, Klippan och Lund.*

*Vi säljer bilar och bilrelaterade kringtjänster som ger kunden ett bekvämt och miljövänligt bilägande. Vi strävar efter att vår personal skall känna arbetsglädje och genom engagerat uppträdande värna om företagets traditioner samt spegla våra kärnvärden hjärta & kompetens. Vårt mål är att ha Bil-Sveriges nöjdaste kunder och engagerade medarbetare varav vi ständigt har fokus på vår personal, kvalitets- och miljöarbete.*  



**Vill du vara med och utveckla Bilmånssons varumärke?**


Bilbranschen är inne i ett av sina mest intensiva och spännande skeden någonsin med många tekniska lösningar på gång i närtid. Elektrifiering och nya sätt att äga bil är en del av en intressant och positiv förändringsresa framåt!


En sak är dock säker – för att lyckas i framtiden behöver vi fortsätta att stärka vårt varumärke, skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer och ge kunderna världens bästa service.


Vill du vara med oss på denna spännande resa? Nu har du chansen då vi söker en Marknadsassistent till Bilmånsson!

**Ditt uppdrag**


Som Marknadsassistent har du en central roll på Bilmånsson som en del av vår marknadsavdelning. Vi supporterar alla anläggningar och arbetar nära både bilförsäljningen och servicemarknaden. Som Marknadsassistent hos oss kommer du att arbeta med allt som händer på en marknadsavdelning, högt och lågt – ingen dag är den andra lik! Tillsammans med vårt marknadsteam kommer du att arbeta både med Bilmånssons eget varumärke, men även med några av Sveriges mest kända bilmärken.


Vi söker dig som är i början av karriären och vill utvecklas i ditt yrke tillsammans med oss. Som person är du driven, flexibel, snabblärd och har ett sinne för ordning och reda. Du trivs när det händer mycket och tycker att det är spännande med förändring.


Som medarbetare hos oss på Bilmånsson blir du en del av ett härligt gäng med bra sammanhållning där alla hjälper alla.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

* Arbeta med våra digitala ytor såsom; sociala medier, nyhetsmejl och hemsida.
* Kampanjhantering i Meta Ads Manager.
* Eventkoordinering.
* Skapa grafiskt material för både digitala kanaler och tryck.
* Fotografering och redigering av bilder.
* Målgruppssegmentering och arbete med CRM-system.
* Övriga operativa och administrativa uppgifter.

**Kunskaper:**

* Relevant utbildning inom marknadsföring/kommunikation eller motsvarande.
* Lätt för att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift.
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom Adobe Creative Cloud, främst Photoshop och InDesign.
* Förståelse för människors beteende och rörelsemönster i digitala plattformar och andra medier.
* Kunskap om hur sociala medier fungerar och påverkar våra beteenden.
* Meriterande med filmkunskaper eller erfarenhet av Wordpress/webbutveckling.

**Personliga egenskaper:**

* Service-minded och sätter alltid kunden i focus.
* Noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten.
* Kreativ förmåga, lätt för att skapa.
* God samarbetsförmåga samtidigt som du är van och gillar att arbeta självständigt och leverera mot mål.

**Anställningsform, omfattning och placeringsort**


Anställningen är tillsvidare, heltid med placering i Ängelholm. Arbete på våra övriga orter kommer att förekomma.


**Ansökan och tillträde**


Tillträde snarast möjligt. Vi tillämpar löpande urval av inkomna ansökningar. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast den 13/10! Ansökningar tas endast emot via vårt ansökningsformulär på hemsidan.


Vill du veta mer om tjänsten? Kontakta Amanda Nyhlén, Marknadsföringsansvarig, på 0431-898 04 eller amanda.nyhlen@bilmansson.se.


Varmt välkommen till oss!

title: Property Systems Support Specialist
description:
**Hotel Distribution Systems, Connectivity and Customer Service are no alien words to you?**

Join BWH Hotels, where we celebrate what makes each of our hotels unique and the special experiences they offer. As a global hotel chain, we are all about going the extra mile to support our hotels and help them to deliver top-notch guest experiences.


Right now, we are looking for a service-savvy superstar who is eager to help our hotels conquer the world of Property and Distribution Systems.


If you thrive on making a difference, value personalized service and have a passion for all types of systems we want you to become our next **Property Systems Support Specialist.**

**Do you have previous experience with reservations and booking systems and are you now ready to take the next step by supporting and navigating our hotels through the maze of Systems? Would you like to describe yourself as hands-on and pro-active?**


If the answer is Yes – look no further and apply to become BWH’s next **Property Systems Support Specialist**.


As **Property Systems Support Specialist** you are part of the Technology and Distribution Team based in Stockholm.


As a person you are a creative problem solver, and you have a passion for all types of systems.


You are someone who naturally likes to find solutions, has no difficulty in connecting the dots and likes to help people in any way. In your view, obstacles are only opportunities in disguise.


You enjoy working as part of a dynamic team which not only strives to succeed but also values collaboration and celebrates achievements together. You are a team player, pro-active and you like to go the extra mile.

**Your superpowers**

  

* 2-3 years’ experience in hotel operations / hotel reservations and/front office or booking systems
* In depth knowledge of at least one PMS system: Opera | Opera Cloud, Hotsoft, Suite8 or Mews
* Experience in a helpdesk or customer/guest service environment
* Confident to set up and hold training and webinars for our hotels
* Communicate fluently in Swedish and English

**Your tasks as a Property Systems Support Specialist**

* Provide day-to-day support to hotels with any questions related to property and distribution systems
* Play a supporting role during the onboarding of a new BWH franchise property or PMS and complete distribution related tasks during the integration phase of a new Hotel/PMS
* Facilitate and hold trainings/webinars and be the hotel’s go-to person during the first months as a BWH franchise property
* Continually observe day-to-day system status and assure BWH hotels are bookable in all BWH systems and booking channels (OTA, GDS, Brand Web, Direct Connects)
* Assists in the development and documentation of standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, training materials, and checklists
* Take ownership of assigned products and projects

 **BWH Hotels Scandinavia** **–** **local gems everywhere in Scandinavia**


BWH Hotels is a leading global hotel network consisting of three hotel chains – WorldHotels Collection, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, and SureStay Hotel Group.


Best Western Hotels & Resorts (BWHR) is an iconic hotel chain with over 70 years of experience. Today, BWHR comprises 10 brands with 3- and 4-star hotels. To enhance its offerings, SureStay Hotel Group was also created, featuring three brands in the economy segment.


WorldHotels boasts an incredible collection of hotels and resorts in various destinations worldwide, spanning the exclusive and luxurious segments. The acquisition of WorldHotels creates a hotel portfolio with options in every market segment – from economy to luxury.


BWH Hotels acts as an umbrella organization for the 18 different brands. This establishes a global network of approximately 4,300 hotels in nearly 100 countries around the world.

title: System Manager - Financial Systems
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform for savings and investments. For more than 25 years, our purpose has been to democratize savings and investments. Through innovation, simplicity, and transparency, we challenge traditional structures and give private savers access to the same information, tools, and services as professionals.


We are building the next generation of digital banking in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.


Do you want to join us and help shape the future of Nordnet?

**About the role:**


We are seeking a highly engaged System Manager to oversee and optimize our finance systems, with an initial focus on Quantum, and additional responsibilities for Business Central and Cognos Controller. You will be part of the Tech organization, reporting to the IT Operations Manager for system management within the Change & System Management department.


As the System Manager, your primary responsibility will be managing Quantum, where you will operate on both an operational and tactical level, while also supporting the system owner at a strategic level. As you establish and optimize Quantum, your role will gradually expand to include Business Central and Cognos Controller.


In addition to these responsibilities, you will play a critical role in Nordnet’s cloud journey. We are transitioning from on-premise systems to cloud-based solutions, and you will be at the forefront of this transformation. Your expertise will be vital as we move our finance systems to the cloud, ensuring a seamless and secure migration process.


Collaboration is key in this role, as you will work closely with stakeholders across various departments at Nordnet, including product owners, business analysts, engineers, and operational teams.


On a daily basis, you will manage system operations, including development, user management, support, and maintenance, acting as the primary contact internally and with our third-party suppliers. You will also contribute to the department's overall goals, such as increasing scalability at Nordnet and reducing costs. The time you spend between system management and other projects will vary depending on the system roadmap, your interests, and your personal development.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **System Management:** Initially focus on enhanced management of Quantum, with a gradual expansion of responsibility including Business Central and Cognos Controller.
* **Cloud Transition:** Lead and support the migration of our finance systems from on-premise infrastructure to cloud-based solutions.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Manage communications and relations with the Technical System Manager, internal stakeholders, and external parties.
* **Incident Resolution:** Address and resolve system incidents and problems.
* **Access Control:** Manage access, controls, and audits for the systems.
* **Risk Management:** Ensure correct risk management and regulatory compliance across systems.
* **System Maintenance:** Plan and manage system maintenance, including coordinating development, testing, and changes both internally and with vendors.
* **Strategic Contribution:** Support the system owner in strategic initiatives and contribute to the overall department goals.

**About You:**


We believe you are ready to take the next step in your career and are eager to develop further. You have an eye for details and simultaneously able to see the bigger picture in processes and areas of work. Your social skills, coupled with a strong technical interest, will be key to your success in this role, where you’ll be at the center of operations, coordinating with both internal users and external parties.


You have a high drive, a strong commitment, and are comfortable working independently in a dynamic environment where priorities can shift rapidly. Quick decision-making is natural to you, and you have a high learning ability, driven by a curiosity to understand the technical aspects of Nordnet, including system integrations and data management.

**To Succeed in This Role, You Should Have:**

* Ability to work independently and lead your own initiatives.
* Deep and broad knowledge of treasury and finance processes.
* Extensive experience with Quantum, Business Central, Cognos Controller, or similar systems.
* Strong technical interest, including prior skills with SQL and/or T-SQL.


Join us at Nordnet, where your contributions will be pivotal in building the financial systems of the future and leading our cloud transformation.

*Language skills*

  

You are fluent in English in writing and speaking.  

  

**We offer**  

  

We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.  

  

Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.  

  

We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.  

  

Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com and https://career.nordnetab.com


**Questions & applications**  

  

If you have questions, please contact Talent Acqusition Partner, Joachim Öberg at joachim.oberg@nordnet.se.  

  



Please apply today by using the button below – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.


We want to inform you that Nordnet conduct credit, drug test and background checks as a part of the recruitment process.  

  



We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Program Manager to SEB Group \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
We are seeking a skilled and high performing Program Manager to lead exiting and complex programs at SEB. You will play a pivotal role in leading SEB programs targeting digitalization, new and improved products, staying compliant with emerging regulations and much more.

**About the job:**

The market we operate in and the world around us is rapidly changing. We thrive to be on top of the emerging trends and developments by adapting our financial solutions to our customers. We’re leading projects cross the bank, in an agile environment, to ensure our transformation journeys that will future proof the bank.

You will be long to the central project team within Group CIO, which focuses on technology to ensure the future of banking, with a forward-leaning mind-set and work in areas such as Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, and data management.
### **Role responsibilities includes;**

* Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of large-scale programs, managing dependencies and risk efficiently
* Securing the right prioritization, coordinating the project´s progress and proactively identify and address impediments to ensure delivery
* Lead and interact with stakeholders, vendors and partners
* Collaborate with a project sponsor, usually a senior business manager
* Utilize agile frameworks, to guide and coach teams to achieve their full potential

### **Qualifications needed to succeed in this role;**

* Demonstrated success in delivering large-scale programs
* 10+ years of experience of leading change as a Program Manager or similar leading role
* Ability to navigate complex organizational structures and drive consensus
* Strong understanding and application of Scaled agile principles and practices
* Exceptional leadership and communication skills, have the ability to inspire, motivate teams and build your own network
* A background from the Finance business is seen as an advantage

### **What we offer:**

* Make a lasting impact by leading prioritized programs that are important to future proof the bank
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Be a part of a great, professional, and welcoming team. Most of your colleagues are very experienced Project and Program Managers but there are also a few more junior colleagues.
* You will have the possibility to contribute to the development of methodology and ways of working to continuously improve our way of delivering on SEB’s vision


This is a full-time employment positioned in Arenastaden, Stockholm. **Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
**Welcome with your application**
Attach your CV and a short personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. We select candidates on running basis, so feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-10-02. If you have questions about the position, please contact Elina Burvall, Head of Group CIO Project Management, by e-mail elina.burvall @seb.se
**Learn more about working at SEB** www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Customer Success Partner Senior Advisor - SAP LeanIX
description:
**We help the world run better**


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

 **What you’ll do**

  



We are looking for a Customer Success Partner Senior Advisorto join our growing team and guide customers through their journey, making them successful.


Are you passionate about IT and how it enables modern businesses to grow? Do you share the mindset of being customer-first, striving for excellence while winning & losing as a team?  

Then it is worth reading on!


Closely aligned with your customers and our Customer Success-, Sales-, Professional Services-, Product-, Marketing- and Partner Management teams, you will be working on delivering continuous value.


As a Customer Success Partner Senior Advisoryou create an impact having exceptional analytical and advisory skills to support our customers in the best way possible. You will take on full responsibility for Enterprise customers along their journey – from onboarding to adoption, expansion, and renewal.

* Working within a great team, supporting, and motivating each other in a culture that welcomes feedback and failure while celebrating our successes
* Take on full responsibility for your 30-40 Enterprise customers based in the Nordics.
* Bulld and strengthen relationships with your customers to become their trusted advisor
* Develop and expand your accounts by driving product adoption to ensure value add
* Work with state-of-the-art Customer Success tools (Gainsight, Salesforce) backed by a Customer Success Operations team
* Add your style to a global, diverse team LeanIX, a fast-growing tech company and leader in the Enterprise Architecture category

 **What you bring**

  

* 8+ years of experience in in a customer-facing role in the B2B SaaS industry (or related business), preferably in the domain of Enterprise Architecture
* Understanding of IT Management and Software Development/Operations in Enterprise organizations
* Ability and experience to structure and prioritise your work and work of others
* 3+ year working knowledge with Customer Success tools, e.g., Gainsight is a plus
* Fluent in English for all territories; plus fluent in Swedish, Norwegian or Finnish.

 **No global mobility budget connected to this role**

 *SAP LeanIX empowers organizations with transparency around their as-is IT landscape, enabling them to visualize its interconnections, assess its support of business capabilities, and manage its continuous transformation.* *LeanIX is now an SAP company and this role will ultimately report into the LeanIX organization. Your application information will therefore be shared across SAP and LeanIX recruiting and hiring teams.*

  

#LeanIX

 **We build breakthroughs together**


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 390304 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: Director of Product
description:
Join us at Avinode Group and be our next Director of Product. Since the early 2000s, Avinode Group has been making life easier in the world of private aviation. As our next Director of Product, you´ll play a central role in driving the success of our sales and marketplace product offering and lead a product team distributed in Sweden.


### **What you will do**


As Director of Product, you’ll lead and grow a team of five Product Managers, driving their development and ensuring they deliver real business impact. You’ll collaborate closely with teams across the organization, working side-by-side with design, engineering, and other product leaders to align efforts with our product strategy, customer needs, and business goals—all while reporting to the Chief Product Officer.


Here’s how you’ll make an impact:


* You’ll mentor and guide your team of Product Managers as a coach and player, helping them become customer-centric, innovative leaders who deliver real results.
* You’ll champion fast, focused product delivery, using lean practices and rapid experimentation to keep things moving forward.
* You’ll align our product strategy with business goals, ensuring every initiative drives growth, boosts customer satisfaction, and improves retention.
* You’ll build strong partnerships across teams, working hand-in-hand with engineering, marketing, sales, and customer success to create seamless collaboration.
* You’ll help bring our Product Operating Model to life, ensuring smooth execution and day-to-day success in everything we do.


Success in this role means delivering products that users truly value, adopt, and actively use.


### **What you will bring**


You are passionate about product development, a doer, and a leader for your team. With a deep understanding of product development, you apply and adapt it to drive results.


You thrive in an operational setting, demonstrating the ability to coach and grow your team. You love solving problems and believe deeply in a customer-led approach, enjoying every opportunity to engage with customers directly. You are a confident star, but you know your biggest stars are your team.


We believe that you have:


* 3+ years of SaaS product leadership experience
* Experience managing teams in a remote environment. We have Noders in Sweden and USA today, and travel is required
* Hands-on experience with SaaS products, particularly in developing customer-facing mobile or web solutions
* A familiarity with marketplace technology and sales tools
* Experience with the Product Operating Model is a plus

### **What do we offer you?**


This role is a chance to drive change across the business aviation industry. Driving change does not happen by accident.  

We are passionate about our work and proud of our high engagement, creativity, and curious culture. But don’t worry—we like to laugh and have fun. As a leader, you will embrace our culture and help us stay relevant.  

We are a fully remote company. You decide where and how you work. We want you to love what you do, but we know we all need to live, so we provide a competitive salary and a set of benefits.


### **Want to join our crew?**


Sounds like a great fit for you? You’ll find more fun facts about our Noders (that’s what we call ourselves) and our culture on our website.


If you have any questions regarding this role, please do not hesitate to email **Emil Oskarsson** at emil.oskarsson@ants.se


### **About Avinode Group**


Avinode Group, owned by CAMP Systems, offers a fully connected suite of essential B2B software to enable Business Aviation professionals through the entire workflow of managing, sourcing, and booking aircraft. Founded in the heart of Sweden in 2002, we support around 2,000 companies globally.


Our essential tools are designed to minimize stress and maximize profit for brokers and operators. The suite includes the world’s leading sourcing platform for air charter, making it easy to find aircraft, book trips, and market aircraft globally. Air charter operators and flight departments are provided with a fully cloud-based fleet management system to make flight operations smoother. Our customers can rely on a hassle-free process from quoting to booking and paying with a fully integrated payment solution.


With 150+ Noders spread between Sweden and the US, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers everyone to come forward with new ideas, try them out, make some mistakes, and initiate dialogue. Avinode Group seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work alongside other intelligent, humorous, and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us daily to exceed expectations.


Avinode Group is an equal opportunity employer and cares about having the best people for the job. We care about your skills and who you are as a person.


Want more details? Discover the value our essentials bring to our customers every day.

title: Receptionist Scandic Grand Central
description:
\*\*Scandic Grand Central är ett nav för kultur i Stockholm!\*\* Med konstutställningar, konserter och en egen teater är det alltid något som händer innanför de anrika väggarna. Vi som arbetar på hotellet trivs i den fartfyllda och kreativa miljön och har en gemensam vilja att erbjuda våra gäster det lilla extra. En mix av det historiska och det moderna beläget mitt i Stockholms hjärta. För dig som uppskattar en internationell och inspirerande social scen som andas musik och kultur. Om du kunde sätta ett stetoskop på Stockholms kropp skulle hjärtljuden slå högst där Scandic Grand Central är. Så vart slår dina hjärtljud? Älskar du musik, konst och kreativa miljöer lika mycket som oss? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Grand Central.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid 40%, två vardagar varannan vecka och varannan helg. Vi tillämpar en provanställning om 6 månader.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: e-Invoicing Regulatory Counsel - Partner management
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Partner Regulatory Counsel -Tax compliance
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Flexible within the UK, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, or Portugal.
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Configuration Manager
description:
*PostNord Group AB is a leading provider of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region. The Nordic Support department is responsible for enabling and ensuring the service management in Group function IT. The unit contributes with designing processes, concepts and implementing them in the service management areas to ensure that the processes provide desired business result.*

**Position Overview:**
----------------------


Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at one of the Nordic region´s largest companies? If you work as a Configuration Manager or Transition Manager and are interested in developing IT processes this is the job for you!


The Configuration Manager is responsible for overseeing the configuration management process within an organization's IT environment. This role involves maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of configuration items (CIs), managing configuration baselines, and ensuring that changes to the IT infrastructure are controlled and documented. The Configuration Manager plays a vital role in supporting other IT service management (ITSM) processes, such as change management and incident management, by providing a reliable and consistent configuration management database (CMDB).

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* Coordinate Configuration Management: Oversee all configuration management activities, including designing, implementing, and managing configuration management process.
* Coordinate Transition management: Oversee all transition management activities, including developing, executing and managing transition plans
* Manage Change Control: Control changes to configuration items and documentation to ensure system integrity.
* Maintain Documentation: Keep accurate records of system configurations, dependencies, and relationships.
* Ensure Compliance: Conduct audits to verify adherence to the configuration management plan.
* Collaborate with Teams: Work with various teams to implement the configuration management plan effectively.
* Monitor Performance: Track problems and changes in product documents, reporting updates and current configurations.

**We are looking for you who have**
-----------------------------------

* A couple of years of work experience within configuration management or transition management or a related role.
* University degree or similar, in relevant field (Computer Science, logistics or technology/IT).
* Process Management framework Knowledge & certification (ITIL).
* English in speaking and writing

### **System requirement:**

* JIRA SM
* Microsoft Office (including visio)
* Sharepoint

### **Meritorious experience:**

* Configuration Management experience preferably in a complex and large IT landscape
* Transition management experience in cloud applications


We believe you have strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling you to clearly articulate ideas and foster meaningful relationships with others. Furthermore, your strong analytical and problem-solving abilities empower you to navigate complex challenges and deliver creative, effective solutions.

**We Offer You:**
-----------------
